description: From German Geist (“spirit, ghost, mind”). Doublet of ghost.

examples: The geists eat and drink, but only as geists — not as spirits. ' We have dined,' they say ' sumptuously.' A vapour- ... If dead men tell no tales, their geists will tell them, if they find opportunity.

entries.meaning: Spirit (of a group, age, era, etc).
examples: [...] a term badly applied, as the method is neither a historicism (the belief that each era or period has a geist, principle of identity, or a definable sense of destiny) nor new.
